SENT.plain: Hereditary mixed polyposis syndrome (HMPS) is a rare condition of unknown genetic origin
The paper presents 25-year clinical follow up in a female patient with multiple gastrointestinal tract polyps of varied histology
They most likely served as sites of multiple colorectal cancers development
The clinical course is interesting in terms of diagnostics and therapy
The patient required extended genetic testing, intensive conservative treatment and numerous surgical procedures
This is the first case of HMPS presented in Polish publications
